intro: Caesalpinia aestivalis, commonly known as the flame tree, is a tropical leguminous plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, bright red or orange feather-like flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces elongated, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often cultivated as an ornamental tree due to its vibrant floral display and ability to thrive in warm climates. The plant also has a symbiotic relationship with nitrogen-fixing bacteria, enhancing soil fertility.
